results.title: Turned round to see
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Frangakis, Karl Holtsnider and Franciscan Communications Center
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about the experiences of a lonely and puzzled 17-year-old boy who wanders into a teenage discotheque. Expresses the need for self knowledge and that such self knowledge leads an individual to reach out to others.

results.title: Turn the soil
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film traces the story of the development of the Australian wheat industry from the days when the first Ridley machine was taken into the crops at harvest time. It shows what scientific research and experimentation are doing today to help the wheat farmer combat rust, low rainfall, wind, weeds, and other pests, and to develop strains of wheat which mature well in spite of adverse climactic conditions.

results.title: Turn a handle, flick a switch. - 2nd rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Shows how basic domestic services, such as gas, electricity and water are provided. Deals with the source of these services, their reticulation and home usage. The program ends with a strong conservation message - “turn off the light, etc.” Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Turkey: emergence of a modern nation
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Reviews the major political and social developments in the Republic of Turkey since its formation in 1923, and shows the influence of cultural traditions dating back to the Greek, Roman and Ottoman empires. Uses map animation to show the relationship between the nation’s geographic position and its strategic position in world affairs. Illustrates the efforts of the Turkish government and people to build a modern, independent industrial nation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Tunnels for the environment
results.brief_description: “Summary: features twin head greenside-mcalpine rock tunnellers at work. the film highlights two major projects: the severn wye cable tunnel to carry national super-grid electricity cables, and at st maximin in france, tunnels for the french water supply network”
results.description: “Summary: features twin head greenside-mcalpine rock tunnellers at work. the film highlights two major projects: the severn wye cable tunnel to carry national super-grid electricity cables, and at st maximin in france, tunnels for the french water supply network”

results.title: Tunnel erosion
results.creator_credit: Rod Power, Soil Conservation Authority of Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Produced to show the distribution, causes, effects and treatment of a form of land surface destruction which, though relatively rare in other parts of the world, is common in Victoria. Animated diagrams explain how such tunnel erosion is the result of movement of water in the subsoil. The latter part of the film gives a detailed account of reclamation methods used on a demonstration area near the Hume Highway at Avenal.
